meta_data_help_body: Provide potential participants with a insightful title, short description of your study and information on who you are and how they can contact you.
interventions_help_body:
Define the interventions that will be offered to the study participants.
Together with the details for each intervention you can also define the tasks the user shall complete for the intervention.
Currently only Checkmark Tasks can be designed.
Checkmark Tasks will prompt the participants at a set time to do something ad check off completion.
eligibility_questions_help_body:
Define the questions you want to ask the participants to check if they are eligible to participate in your study.
You can choose between the following questions:
Yes and No (so called Boolean)
(Multiple) Choice.
eligibility_criteria_help_body:
Using the questions defined in the previous step, define the eligibility criteria, meaning the expected answers the participants need to give to be eligible.
If you want to define a negation, as in "not this answer", first select a "Not" expression and then the targeted "Value" expression.
For (multiple) choice questions select the answer you expect or want to exclude.
observations_help_body:
Define the observations you want to gather from the participants via a questionnaire tasks.
For each questionnaire you can schedule what time the participants should complete it and what questions they should answer.
You can choose between the following questions:
Yes and No (so called Boolean) questions.
(Multiple) Choice questions
Annotated Scale Questions. Design your own scale with annotations at flexible points of the scale.
Visual Analogue Scale Questions. Design your own scale with a colour gradient and annotations at minimum and maximum points of the scale.
schedule_help_body: Set the amount of cycles, the duration of each phase, if a baseline phase should be included and how the order of the phases should be determined.
report_help_body:
Define how the report that your participants receive should look like.
A report includes various sections, the first of which is the primary section.
For each section you can define if the data should be reported as average or via a liner regression of the user's data.
You can choose whether the data is reported for individual days, phases or for each intervention.
 The data source defines which observation the report section is based on.
results_help_body:
Define what results you want to receive back from the study for your own research. For each result you define the filename it should be saved under.
You can get the results for:
The interventions that participants choose and in which order they were conducted
The numeric values that users reported for a selected observation.
consent_help_body: Customize the consent the participants need to provide by adding the various elements of your consent form.
save_help_body: Here you can save your study as draft and continue editing it later or publish it to the StudyU platform.
view_mode_warning: This is a view mode only. The study is published already and therefore changes can not be saved.
title: Title
name: Name
reason: Reason (The reason the participant is excluded)
question: Question
prompt: Prompt (Instruction text shown to the user)
rationale: Rationale (Reason why this information is required from the user)
study_model_in_json: Resulting study model in JSON format
really_want_to_publish: will be published. You will not be able to make changes afterwards!
terms_description: Before you can save or publish your study you need to agree to the terms and app guidelines
terms_agree: I agree to the terms and app guidelines
